name: Cook the Book: Beet Soup with Feta
description: ©iStockPhoto.com/vnlit It's been only within the last year or so that I've acquired a taste for beets. I used to hate the earthy flavor and slightly gritty texture, which reminded me of eating dirt. But my girlfriend loves them,...
recipeIngredient: 3 to 4 medium beets (1 to 1 1/4 pounds total)
2 cups good-quality, strong stock (beef is ideal, but chicken or vegetable will work)
3/4 cup (4 ounces) crumbled Greek feta cheese
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the beets; grate them coarsely (or chop into small dice). Heat the oil in a large pan; sauté the onion a few minutes, until soft. Add the beets and the stock; bring to a boil.

Season lightly with salt and pepper; gently simmer 7 to 10 minutes, until beets are tender. Stir in the tomato sauce, transfer to a blender, and process until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning if need be.
Reheat soup until thoroughly hot but not boiling. Divide among warm bowls; sprinkle the feta over. Serve with crusty bread.
